detail.heading: Mahāvihāra Dhamma School Gwa Branch
detail.introduction: Deep in the forest near Myanmar's border area, there is a little-known branch of the Mahāvihāra Dhamma School – Mahāvihāra Forest Monastery (Gwa). This is where over 150 monks are diligently studying and practicing day and night in a simple, peaceful life filled with the spirit of purity.

lifestyle.title: The Simple Lifestyle of the Monks
lifestyle.description: Located far from Yangon center, access to this school is quite difficult, with most monks having to use boats to leave the area. Life here reflects contentment and frugality, maintaining a pure spirit of study and practice:
points: Food: Mainly vegetarian food, monks eat simply according to tradition.
Robes: The Sangha does not use pre-made robes but cuts and sews them from coarse white fabric, then dyes them with tree bark according to the traditional robe-making method.
Living conditions: Monks live in bamboo kutis, studying under solar-powered lights or candles when necessary.
Utensils: Most are made from natural materials, such as gourds for drinking water, bamboo for shelving, and hollowed wood for containers.

principal.title: Venerable Kawidaza – Principal of Mahāvihāra Gwa
principal.description: The principal of Mahāvihāra Gwa is Venerable Kawidaza, a dedicated teacher who guides the Sangha in studying according to the original teachings. Notably, in April 2024, he and 12 Sayadaws visited Vietnam, bringing compassion and Dhamma to Vietnamese Buddhists.

access.title: Difficulties Accessing Mahāvihāra Gwa
access.description: The area where the school is located is in a civil conflict zone and is strictly controlled, so even Myanmar people from other areas cannot freely access it. For foreigners, coming here is even more difficult. Despite requests, the monks here cannot receive visitors to ensure safety and maintain a pure environment.

contact.title: Contact the Kappiya Supporting the Sangha
contact.description: To support and connect with Mahāvihāra Gwa, Buddhists can contact Kappiya Thet Tun Than Htay, who is supporting the Sangha in Yangon.
contact.note: Note: As the Kappiya has personal work outside, responses may be delayed. Please message in English or ask a Myanmar person to contact for the best support.

detail.conclusion: Mahāvihāra Gwa is one of the Buddhist schools hidden in the deep forest, where monks diligently study and practice the precepts day and night. Though little known, it is a dignified place, embodying a pure lifestyle and the spirit of mindful retreat. If Buddhists wish to support, please contact Kappiya Thet Tun Than Htay for more details.
